name: Pakistan Bar Council Appeal (Amendment) Rules, 1990
tagline: Amendments to the Pakistan Bar Council Appeal Rules, 1986
content:
242 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., MAR. 4, 1990 [PART II 
PAKISTAN BAR COUNCIL 
Rawalpindi, the 28th February, 1990 
. R. O. 229  1 	—In exercise of the powers conferred by section 55 of 
the e 	ractitioners & Bar Councils Act, 1973 (XXXV of 1973), and other 
enabling provisions in that behalf the Pakistan Bar Council hereby makes and 
notifies the following amendments in the Pakistan Bar Council Appeal Rules, 1986. 
Short title and commencement : 
These Rules may be called the "Pakistan Bar Council Appeal • 
(Amendment) Rules, 1990. 
They shall come into force at once. 
2. Amendment of Rules 5 : 
(a) The words "of receipt of an Appeal" be inserted between the 
words " days " and " for " occurring in sub-rule (i) of Rule 5. 
(b) The existing sub-rule (ii) of Rule 5 be substituted by the following: 
"(ii) For the admission of appeal and grant of interim relief it shall 
not be necessary to call a meeting of the Committee and it 
will be sufficient if the appeal is circulated amongst the 
Members of the Committee. 
Every order or decision of the Committee shall be taken by majority 
(c) The existing sub-rule (iii) of Rule 5 be substituted by the 
following : 
"(iii) The Appeal Committee shall hear the appeal, examine the1.  
record of the case, and record such evidence as it may deem-
necessary after providing opportunity of hearing to the 
parties. The Appeal Committee shall decide the appetd 
within two months and its decision shall be deemed to be 
the decision of the Pakistan Bar Council. " 
3. Deletion of Rule 6 : 
The existing Rule 6 may be omitted. 
[No. 5319 PBCISECT901. RAJA HAQ NAWAZ KHAN, 
We-Chairman. 
MOHAMMAD ARSHAD. Secretary.
